blackdoor.util

Class ExperimentalCrypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackdoor.util.ExperimentalCrypto

  • public class ExperimentalCrypto
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    kAG0 a class containing simple static implementations of secure but non-standardized encryption algorithms

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Crypto.EncryptionResult doSHE(byte[] input, byte[] key, byte[] IV)
      Simple/Secure Hash Encryption encryption/decryption method which uses the identical nature of the encryption and decryption algorithms in the counter (CTR) mode of operation for block ciphers to use a one way hash function instead of a typical encryption algorithm.
      static byte[] doSHEBlock(ExperimentalCrypto.Block block, byte[] key)
      Calculate a single block with SimpleHashEncryption (see doSHE for details)

    • Method Detail

      • doSHEBlock

        public static byte[] doSHEBlock(ExperimentalCrypto.Block block,
                byte[] key)
        Calculate a single block with SimpleHashEncryption (see doSHE for details)
        Parameters:
        block - The block number, text and initialization vector for the block that is to be calculated
        key - a 128 bit or stronger key
        Returns:
        an array containing the calculated block

      • doSHE

        public static Crypto.EncryptionResult doSHE(byte[] input,
                            byte[] key,
                            byte[] IV)
        Simple/Secure Hash Encryption encryption/decryption method which uses the identical nature of the encryption and decryption algorithms in the counter (CTR) mode of operation for block ciphers to use a one way hash function instead of a typical encryption algorithm. SHE uses SHA256 with a 256bit block size, and a key of at least 126 bits and an IV of at least 256 bits. This method operates as a block cipher,
        Parameters:
        input - The text to calculate, must be less that 2GB or 2^32 bytes, due to array restrictions in java.
        key - The key to use for encryption/decryption, must be at least 128 bits.
        IV - The initializaiton vector to use, must be at least 256 bits.
        Returns:
        An EncryptionResult containing the iv and calculated text.
